member.summary: Initialize a ServiceClient instance to process credentials.
member.remarks: This will add a certificate to the shared root WebRequestHandler in the ServiceClient's HttpClient handler pipeline.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.CertificateCloudCredentials.ProcessHttpRequestAsync(System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Apply the credentials to the HTTP request.
member.returns: Task that will complete when processing has completed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.CertificateCloudCredentials.SubscriptionId
member.summary: Gets subscription ID which uniquely identifies Windows Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every call that you make to the Service Management API.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.CertificateCloudCredentials.ManagementCertificate
member.summary: The Windows Azure Service Management API use mutual authentication of management certificates over SSL to ensure that a request made to the service is secure. No anonymous requests are allowed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Common.Platform.CertificateCloudCredentialsProvider

member.returns: Returns a new instance if the provider supports the provided settings.
